intro: Evaiezoa aizoides, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Evaiezoa aizoides is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
